candidates.title: fix: whoami crash on FreeBSD aarch platform
Fix for Postgres decimals
candidates.body:
See additional details #888 
`0.01` conversions could've been easily fixed without rewriting the whole thing, there's just one edge case that needs to be handled (see 2nd commit).
I couldn't find a standalone reproducer for the issue mentioned above, however, everything works fine with my branch.

candidates.title: examples/mysql/todos/Cargo.toml:  Add runtime feature
candidates.body: This gets the MySQL example compiling again :)

candidates.title: Replace lru-cache with hashlink
Add support for bstr::BString and git2::Oid, behind feature flags
candidates.body:
This adds support for SQL conversions for the bstr::BString binary
string type, and for the git2::Oid object ID type. Both types are
encoded and decoded as bytes.

These types are database-independent and work with any database that can
handle bytes, so add tests that work with sqlite.

candidates.title: Add postgres example with test of business logic
candidates.body:
This PR adds a Postgres example based on the ideas in [this blog post](https://medium.com/better-programming/structuring-rust-project-for-testability-18207b5d0243).

We also fixed the existing postgres/todos example (2nd commit).  If you want us to pull this out into a separate PR then we can do.

If this PR is ok, then we have a stab at making an example for transactions as well, potentially using the `Acquire` trait.

candidates.title: Fixing PostgreSQL BigDecimal conversion problems
update libsqlite3-sys to 0.20
fix(cli): wait for newlines for confirmations
Remove hashbrown dependency
candidates.body:
Hashbrown is now the hashmap used in the standard library, so no need to
pull in an external dependency.

Closes https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/731

candidates.title: Enable all features for `sqlx-core` on docs.rs
candidates.body:
Fixed version of #697. I tested that this compiles, although not that it fixes the broken links.

r? @mehcode

candidates.title: Delete target/sqlx before invoking cargo in `cargo sqlx prepare`
Fix pg todos example
candidates.body: Adds the example project to the workspace manifest, resolves #380

candidates.title: Update some dependency versions on sqlx-core
JSON+macros example using overrides
candidates.body: Simple example of the usage of macro overrides with JSON data, following the same pattern as the todos example.

candidates.title: Remove rust_decimal unnecessary dependency num-traits
candidates.body:
num_bigint::BigInt, rust_decimal::Decimal use same trait ToPrimitive from crate nums-traits(0.2).

https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/blob/9ea5ce01a2b04779203bd086e7eb1358ada70ec1/sqlx-core/src/postgres/types/decimal.rs#L2

`use rust_decimal::prelude::ToPrimitive;` is as same as `use num_traits::ToPrimitive;`

The num_traits dependency is unnecessary.

https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/blob/9ea5ce01a2b04779203bd086e7eb1358ada70ec1/sqlx-core/src/postgres/types/decimal.rs#L71

candidates.title: fix: allow queries that select just void to pass through macros as `()` instead of `struct { _1: () }`
(BREAKING: 0.5) patch nullable inference in Postgres using EXPLAIN
candidates.body:
BREAKING CHANGE: some columns emitted by `query!()` and `query_as!()`, primarily those brought in by a `[LEFT | RIGHT | FULL] JOIN` will become `Option<T>` where they were `T` before.

In practice breakage should be minimal as these would result in `UnexpectedNull` errors at runtime unless they were manually overridden with `foo as "foo?"` already.

However, I expect there to be edge cases that aren't covered yet, thus why we've chosen to land this in 0.5 and kick out an early alpha for testing.

* requires the `json` feature (and thus the `serde` and `serde_json` features) to always be on for `postgres` (to parse `EXPLAIN VERBOSE` output, possible formats are JSON, XML, YAML or text)

closes #367

candidates.title: cargo-sqlx-cli: Fix exiting with 0 on failure
candidates.body: And also update the console dependency so it no longer gets compiled twice (0.10 direct, 0.11 indirect).

candidates.title: Embedded migrations
candidates.body:
This PR implements embedded migrations with a new `migrate!` macro. The macro takes an optional string literal for specifying the migrations directory, which defaults to `"migrations"`. It expands to a static instance of `Migrator`.

```rust
sqlx::migrate!().run(&pool).await?;
```

Addresses #550

chosen_pr.body:
See additional details #888 
`0.01` conversions could've been easily fixed without rewriting the whole thing, there's just one edge case that needs to be handled (see 2nd commit).
I couldn't find a standalone reproducer for the issue mentioned above, however, everything works fine with my branch.

repo.name: sqlx
repo.description: 🧰 The Rust SQL Toolkit. An async, pure Rust SQL crate featuring compile-time checked queries without a DSL. Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite.
